title: The Masterpiece of the Month: Christ Preaching, Etching and Drypoint by Rembrandt van Rijn, Clarence Buckingham Collection
description: During August 1939, a famous etching titled “Christ Preaching (La Petite Tombe)” by renowned Dutch artist, Rembrandt van Rijn, was Masterpiece of the Month. This print is a great display of Rembrandt’s mastery of value manipulation and composition. According to the newsletter announcing its exhibition, “[Rembrandt] may have had in mind Matthew 9:35, ‘And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the gospel of the kingdom…’”

input: The Masterpiece of the Month: Christ Preaching, Etching and Drypoint by Rembrandt van Rijn, Clarence Buckingham Collection
